result.execSummary:
The defendant Alfredo Bonifacio-Santos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AODA and follow through

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Medical expenses, amount to be determined within 60 days.    Hearing may be requested

timeConds.notes: Report no later than 6:00 pm on 7-6-15

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alfredo Bonifacio-Santos

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alfredo  Bonifacio-Santos in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Susan Rascon duly sworn on oath.   Court calls  @ 8:33 a.m.  Was scheduled for plea/sentencing, however, State believes Def has changed his mind. Atty Roley advises that Def has decided not to accept plea agreement. State asks to put agreement that was offered on the record, gives reason. Court will allow. Def would plead to charge, State would recommend withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, restitution - amt to be determined, State would argue for 120 days jail or stipulate to 60 days as condition of probation. Advises possible penalties if goes to trial. Def having trouble understanding. Statements repeated with Interpreter speaking consecutively instead of simultaneously. Def understands. Court allows Def to consult with Atty. Recess 8:42. Resume 9:05. Court recalls, same appearances. Agreement now reached with terms set earlier. Atty Roley believes Def understands. Court reviews charge and possible penalties. No contest plea. Court reviews plea quest. and constitutional rights. Atty Roley satisfied. Def signs Spanish plea quest. Court reads statement regarding deportation/naturalization. Court finds Def finds guilty of substantial battery. Statement by Atty Roley for Defendant. Nothing by Def.
Court accepts agreement. Withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, restitution - medical expenses, amt to be determined within 60 days, hrg may be requested, costs including $250 DNA surcharge, apply bond, 60 days jail, w/ huber, report no later than 6 p.m. on 7/6/15. Def advised of voting and firearms restrictions.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.

Defendant Alfredo Bonifacio-Santos in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Susan Rascon.  Called 1:43 p.m. Interpreter duly sworn on oath. Def is waiving preliminary hrg. Court reviews waiver with Defendant and reviews prelim rights. Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause. Def bound over. Information filed. Copy received. Information read. Not guilty plea. Court enters plea. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Clinton Roley in court by phone.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is set for preliminary hearing on 11-25-14.  Atty Roley has a family emergency tomorrow and requesting an adjournment.  Court will cancel interpreter.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
